channel.title: Driving Test Tips (UK)
channel.description:
My test is in 3 days now, and the nerves are starting to set in. I took two mock tests today and failed both of them with 1 major in each. What would be appreciated is to find out why anyone on here failed specifically. My two majors were clipping a kurb, and misleading signal when getting back in to a lane. Two mistakes I wont make again. I have 4 hours worth of lessons left, and an hour or two in my own car.
Gargh :confused:

item.title: Driving Test Tips (UK)
item.dc:creator: @XxKanexX Kane.
item.description:
@XxKanexX wrote:

[quote=“Lothy, post:52, topic:327533”][quote author=Kane. link=topic=423922.msg3120858#msg3120858 date=1265508883]

BTW I failed, I didn’t check my left blind spot while moving off… three times.

Why would I need to check my left blind spot? Incase someone runs out of the pavement into the back of my car?

Someone give me info on rebooking with DSA, because they say latest is April. How do you get one in like 2 weeks?

In the DART test here (from L’s to provisional) it states you have to check left for pedestrians or cyclist.
So fucking gay.
Anyone who steps or rides out in front of a car deserves to be hit.
[/quote]
Are you sure? I don’t recall such a requirement. Obviously when taking off from the curb we have to look in our right side mirror to make sure there’s a big enough gap, followed by a check of our back right blind spot. Nobody ever made any mention of checking the left side to me, and I never lost marks for it when I sat the test a few years ago.[/quote]
I think It’s in the handbook somewhere. You have to check left and right before taking off from a traffic light too in case of pedestrians.

Maybe It’s just new? Like the new rule of indicating left before exiting a round about. Which I think is just stupid and pointless seeing as It’s like flashing for 2 seconds.

But apparently you lose points by not doing it.

item.title: Driving Test Tips (UK)
item.dc:creator: @Thebeanie TheBeanie
item.description:
@Thebeanie wrote:

ownagesbot:

I failed first time, 1major 10minors, booked straight back in passed with 2 minors. I was just nervous the first time, mucked up the parallel park. Second time I just thought “i dont fuckin care” and passed with flying colours. Just keep checking your mirror like a headless chicken man. If you havent looked in the last 5/6seconds then you arn’t lookin enough, dont give them any excuse to fail you. When doing parks / turns etc. just dont worry about it, take it slow steady keep checking mirrors and behind you.

Apparently the biggest thing people fail on is mirrors… As long as u keep checking em you got a good chance of passing.

My dad had a pupil couple weeks ago where she did the whole test and she woulda passed… She got 200yards from the testing station and stopped in the wrong place and they failed her for a major.

found something out about my dad too… apparently hes one of the best driving instructors in the whole of the UK for Bill plant and IS the best in my area. Ha nice.

item.title: Driving Test Tips (UK)
item.dc:creator: @Greeny Greeny
item.description:
@Greeny wrote:

You check your mirrors when exiting a roundabout for people who are in the wrong lane. Primarily it’s when you turn right - if you’re in the right hand lane going round the roundabout, about to turn off on say the third exit (so the right turn from your original position) you need to cut accross the left hand lane - which should be empty if people have been giving way correctly. However occasionally you get the odd dickhead who snook up on you, and if you weren’t to look into your left mirror a collision would be difficult to avoid.

Obviously if you do look in your mirror, you see them and just continue back round the roundabout or pomp like a motherfucker collide and get a fat insurance claim.

That may be difficult to understand but the reasoning behind mirrors is justified, it’s just when you pass your test you’ll probably forget about all of them except the centre

Remember, you don’t learn to drive, you learn to pass the test. You’ll only learn to drive after you’ve passed and get out there on your own and experience driving.
